message.content:
1. The study design was set up to compare hospitalization duration between an active group and a control group.
2. The mean hospitalization duration was 34% shorter in the active group compared to the control group.
3. The difference in hospitalization duration between the active and control group was statistically significant (P < 0.001).
4. HM was used in the study.
5. HM facilitated the early detection of technical issues.
6. HM facilitated the detection of clinical anomalies.

messages.content:
Statement: By study design, the mean hospitalization duration was 34% shorter in the active than in the control group (P < 0.001), and HM facilitated the early detection of technical issues and detectable clinical anomalies.

List all the facts we explicitly know from the statement. Make each fact as atomic as possible.
